item.title: Beth add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "The mind was dreaming. The world was its dream." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Beth add a quote by Alberto Manguel
item.description: "Only when, years later, I touched for the first time my lover's body did I realize that literature could sometimes fall short of the actural event." -- Alberto Manguel

item.title: Beth add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "All growth is a leap in the dark, a spontaneous unpremeditated act without the benefit of experience." -- Henry Miller

item.title: Beth add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description: "When men stop believing in God, it isn't that they then believe in nothing: they believe in everything." -- Umberto Eco

item.title: Beth add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "The pages are still blank, but there is a miraculous feeling of the words being there, written in invisible ink and clamoring to become visible" -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Beth add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "The only thing worse than a boy who hates you: a boy that loves you." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Beth add a quote by Jonathan Ames
item.description: "I live for coincidences. They briefly give to me the illusion or the hope that there's a pattern to my life, and if there's a pattern, then maybe I'm moving toward some kind of destiny where it's all explained." -- Jonathan Ames

item.title: Beth add a quote by Elsa Maxwell
item.description: "laugh at yourself first, before anyone else can" -- Elsa Maxwell

item.title: Beth add a quote by Elsa Maxwell
item.description: "Nothing spoils a good party like a genius." -- Elsa Maxwell
